meanings.definition: Not containing any hydrogen atoms capable of forming hydrogen bonds.
meanings.sent1: The aprotic solvent did not have any hydrogen atoms to create bonds.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used an aprotic solvent in the experiment to avoid hydrogen bonding.
meanings.sent3: The aprotic solution was like a ghost in the lab, never interacting with other molecules.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chemistry, the aprotic solvent was a lone wolf, refusing to bond with others.
meanings.sent5: The aprotic nature of the solvent made it stand out among the other solutions.

meanings.definition: Lacking the ability to donate protons in a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The aprotic compound could not give away any protons during the reaction.
meanings.sent2: Chemists prefer using aprotic solvents when they need substances that won't donate protons.
meanings.sent3: The aprotic molecule was like a shy guest at the chemical party, never offering to donate protons.
meanings.sent4: The aprotic substance stood silent in the reaction, unable to share its protons with others.
meanings.sent5: The aprotic nature of the compound made it a reliable choice for reactions that required no proton donation.
